definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Love is the little red umbrella in rainy days, under the umbrella it is always sunny days.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是風雨中的那把小紅傘，傘下永遠是明朗的天。

sentences.english: The sight of that wally hiding under a brolly at Wembley Stadium will haunt me for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 那個在溫布利躲在傘下的蘇格蘭人會讓我噁心到明年。

sentences.english: She sat under a striped umbrella.
Yes, she was still there, a yellow spot under an orange umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 是的，她還在那兒，橘黃色傘下的一個小黃點。

sentences.english: Market stalls have sprung up under bright umbrellas.
sentences.chinese: 市場上小販們在明亮的的傘下做着生意。

sentences.english: Nan held the umbrella tightly, under which we were walking hard.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶緊緊的撐着傘，我們在傘下艱難前行。

sentences.english: We believe that Smurfs put their 'embryos' in the button of a developing mushroom.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲藍精們把它們的晶胚放在生長的蘑菇傘下。

sentences.english: Love is the little red umbrella in rainy days under the umbrella it is always sunny days.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是風雨中的那把小紅傘，傘下永遠是明朗的天。

definition: Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
to make a sound effect/sound effect/(historical linguistics) to reconstruct the sound system of an archaic language
(bird species of China) Eurasian skylark (Alauda arvensis)
to stay/to remain/to linger/(computing) to reside/resident (program etc)
